values.activities: Japan America Culture & Language Exchange Club (JPAM)

values.notes: Study abroad in Japan for half a year

headline: Full-Stack Software Engineer

values.summary:
9-week intensive training program for web development, focusing on Ruby on Rails, JavaScript, Test-Driven-Development and Model-View-Controller Frameworks

Accelerated training program in full-stack web development

● 1000+ hours of web development training, including pair programming challenges and fully developed web applications
● Group web development projects using Ruby, JavaScript, Rails, Sinatra, React, Mapbox, HTML5/CSS, ActiveRecord, and deployment through Heroku
● Utilized Git and Github for distributed workflow across project teams
● Test-Driven Development / Behavior-Driven Development (TDD/BD) training and best practices (RSpec, Jasmine, Capybara, Rack)
● Integrated object-oriented (OO) design patterns and concepts, as well as various Model-View-Controller (MVC) patterns in web applications
values.title: Apprentice

company.name: Consulate General of Japan in San Francisco

values.summary:
● Designed marketing materials and marketed at over 50 recruiting events, successfully recording the contact information of 1300 people
● Led the complete interview process for the program twice. Each time personally interviewed 35+ applicants and trained 25+ interviewers to effectively interview 150+ people over 3 days
● Planned and coordinated 3 large events (150+ attendees) and 3 medium events (80+ attendees), which included orientations, training workshops, panel discussions, and receptions
● Successfully recruited, interviewed, trained, and sent 326 participants to Japan, with an average job performance evaluation rating of 9.8 out of 10
values.title: Japan Exchange and Teaching (JET) Program Coordinator

values.summary:
●	Guided a total of 35 high school students and 3 Japanese teachers over two 10-day excursions in 3 US states through all scheduled activities, including arrival/departure at airports, mealtimes, orientation, sightseeing, travel to/from homestay locations, and host school activities
●	Interpreted and translated between group members, vendors, students, and others throughout the trip as needed
●	Ensured the safety and well-being of all members of the group by keeping the group together and handling medical and other emergency situations
●	Facilitated strong “kizuna bonds” between the Japanese group and American culture, language, and people that will continue the positive cycle of international exchange
values.title: Kizuna Project Guide / Kakehashi Project Guide

values.summary:
Miyazaki Prefecture, Miyakonojo City Board of Education

●	Coordinated with Japanese English teachers to plan, prepare, and conduct 20 classes per week for more than 2,000 students at over 17 different schools for 3 years
●	Increased students' interest in English from average score of 4 to 9 on 10-point scale as recorded on evaluations
●	Incorporated multimedia in lessons by creating over 75 videos of American culture and by engaging students and their families with website containing teaching materials and videos
●	Hosted two real-time Skype sessions between Japanese and American junior high school classes to foster international understanding and interest in each other's culture
values.title: Assistant Language Teacher (ALT)

summary: Passionate and driven software developer with strong professional leadership, educational, and international experience looking for a challenging new position and motivated team to dedicate myself to.
